lessonSubtitleText: Test how well you know this story

questions.text: What did Jacob learn from talking to the shepherds at the well?
answers: He was near his Uncle Laban’s house
He needed to travel for three more days
They had never heard of Laban
He was in the wrong country

questions.text: Who came walking to the well while Jacob was talking?
answers: Laban’s daughter, Rachel
A pack of robbers
A shepherd Jacob had never met
Leah, Rachel’s sister

questions.text: How long did Jacob live with his uncle?
answers: A month
A week
A year
Ten years

questions.text: When Laban said Jacob shouldn’t work for free, what did Jacob say?
answers: I’ll work seven years if I can marry Rachel
I won’t work at all unless I’m paid money
I will only work for one year
Let me marry Leah instead

questions.text: How did those seven years feel to Jacob? Why?
answers: Like a few days because he loved Rachel
Like a thousand years
Like a normal amount of time
Like a boring chore every day
He secretly gave his daughter Leah to be Jacob’s wife
He made Jacob work twice as long
He refused to let Jacob marry anyone
He sent Rachel far away

questions.text: When Jacob asked why Laban tricked him, what did Laban say?
answers: It’s our custom for the older daughter to be married first
Because I wanted Leah to be happy
Because Rachel didn’t want to marry you
Because you didn’t work hard enough

questions.text: After he married Leah, what deal did Jacob and Laban make?
answers: Wait one week, marry Rachel, work for seven more years
Work for one more year and then leave
Marry Rachel but never work again
Marry neither woman and return home

questions.text: How did Jacob feel about his wives?
answers: He loved Rachel more
He loved Leah more
He loved both the same
He didn’t love either one

questions.text: What is a marriage supposed to be?
answers: One man and one woman
Two people of any kind
Whoever wants to be together
Anyone who makes a promise
